ai-agent-python.name: Python AI Agent
ai-agent-python.instructions: Create FastAPI-based AI agents with LangChain integration. Use for chatbots, AI assistants, conversation handlers, and interactive AI services. Includes rich console output and terminal dashboard. Always use uvicorn.run() with host='0.0.0.0' and port=8000.

code-interpreter-v1.name: Python Code Interpreter
code-interpreter-v1.instructions: Execute Python code for data analysis, calculations, and visualizations. Use for data processing, statistical analysis, machine learning experiments, and generating charts/graphs. Code runs as Jupyter notebook cells with rich output display. No web server required.

nextjs-developer.name: Next.js Developer
nextjs-developer.instructions: Build full-stack React applications with Next.js 14+. Use for web apps, landing pages, dashboards, and interactive frontend applications. Supports TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and modern React patterns. Uses pages router by default. Server runs on port 3000 with hot reload.

vue-developer.name: Vue.js Developer
vue-developer.instructions: Create modern Vue.js 3 applications with Nuxt 3 framework. Use for SPAs, progressive web apps, and modern frontend applications. Supports Composition API, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. Server runs on port 3001 with hot module replacement. Only use when specifically requested for Vue/Nuxt projects.

streamlit-developer.name: Streamlit developer
streamlit-developer.instructions: A streamlit app that reloads automatically.

gradio-developer.name: Gradio developer
gradio-developer.instructions: A gradio app. Gradio Blocks/Interface should be called demo.

r7gjwwzi8z9x5ezdjky8.name: Custom Flask App
r7gjwwzi8z9x5ezdjky8.instructions: A lightweight Flask web application for REST APIs, microservices, or simple web backends. Use for custom Python web services that don't fit other templates.

mlops-fastapi.name: MLOps FastAPI
mlops-fastapi.instructions: ðŸ¤– Build production-ready ML model deployment APIs with comprehensive MLOps capabilities. Use for: ML model serving, experiment tracking with MLflow, data pipeline management with DVC, model monitoring with Evidently, data drift detection, and automated model retraining. Includes structured logging, health checks, and Prometheus metrics. Perfect for deploying trained models as REST APIs with monitoring and observability. Server runs on port 8080 with automatic reload and comprehensive error handling.

react-native-expo.name: React Native Expo
react-native-expo.instructions: ðŸ“± Build cross-platform mobile applications with React Native and Expo. Use for: iOS/Android/Web apps, rapid mobile prototyping, native mobile features, TypeScript development, navigation with React Navigation, and modern mobile UI components. Includes comprehensive testing setup, interactive examples, and platform-specific optimizations. Perfect for creating mobile apps that run on multiple platforms from a single codebase. Development server runs on port 19000 with hot reload and live preview.
